content:
@DPC @Santiago Pastorino what was the best approach for issues closed but still with an I-prioritize label
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3AT-compiler+-label%3AP-critical+-label%3AP-high+-label%3AP-medium+-label%3AP-low+label%3AI-prioritize+is%3Aclosed

Leave the label? Remove the label?
I just remember something somewhere was written but can't find it -_-
but on the other hand given that most of our queries are for open issues having closed issues with I-prioritize doesn't affect us, so I'd say whatever :)

remove the label but a few things:
first check if the issue is closed properly. Sometimes people use closes #<issue no> or related ones in the pr that auto-closes an issue even though there's more to be discussed on the issue.
It doesn't matter much as we filter only on opened issues but if you browse via the threads on zulip, there's no way to know if an issue is closed or not so removing the label would be helpful from that context
oki doki thanks for the feedback. Was just looking to do some housekeeping
